title: Right-wing media seizes on edited clip of CDC director
description: Prominent right-wing figures have been falsely describing a comment CDC Director Dr. Rochelle Waleksny made last week about Covid-19 deaths out of context to wrongly claim she had delivered a dramatic new admission about the 840,000-plus Americans who have died of the virus.

title: 'It might be over for Boris': Journalist on UK PM's 'Watergate' moment
description: The Atlantic's Tom McTague speaks with Christiane Amanpour about the scandal over parties during lockdown that threatens to engulf 10 Downing Street.

title: Early Olympics attendees eat noodles served from ceiling
description: Watch how noodles, rice and burgers are prepared and delivered by robots at the Beijing Olympics Village. Journalists are among the early attendees having this futuristic experience.

title: Aerial video shows perilous state of dam nearing collapse
description: The Carioca dam is located in Brazil's Minas Gerais state, which has been under heavy rainfall since the beginning of the year.

title: Trump ends interview after being pressed about false 2020 election claims
description: Former President Donald Trump made a hasty retreat, hanging up on National Public Radio's Steve Inskeep after he was asked about Republican candidates being forced to back Trump's false claims that the 2020 presidential election was stolen.

title: 'Jeopardy!' champ speaks out about stunning weight loss
description: How a former 'Jeopardy!' contestant got motivated to lose 200 pounds after losing his job to the pandemic.

title: More than 80 fact-checking organizations call out YouTube's 'insufficient' response to misinformation
description: A group of more than 80 fact-checking organizations from around the world has called YouTube "one of the major conduits of online disinformation and misinformation worldwide" and wants the platform to do more to address the problem.

title: A man was apprehended after damaging a plane during boarding process, American Airlines says
description: A man entered the cockpit of an American Airlines plane in Honduras and caused damage while the aircraft was at the gate, the airline said in a statement.

title: Boris Johnson apologizes for attending Downing Street 'bring your own booze' party during lockdown
The highly contagious Omicron variant will 'find just about everybody,' Fauci says, but vaccinated people will still fare better
The big test for inflation is 12 months away
description: Investors are bracing for a report Wednesday expected to show that annual consumer inflation in the United States has climbed to 7% as prices rise at the fastest clip in nearly four decades.

title: Jamie Lynn Spears speaks out in a new interview about strained relationship with sister Britney Spears
description: Jamie Lynn Spears is opening up about what led to her strained relationship with her pop star older sister Britney Spears.

title: Fatal Philadelphia fire likely started with a lighter igniting a Christmas tree, fire commissioner says
description: It's a "near certainty" that a Philadelphia duplex fire that claimed 12 lives was started by a lighter igniting a Christmas tree on the second floor of the building, city Fire Commissioner Adam Thiel said Tuesday.

title: Prince Charles exhibits dozens of his watercolors, saying painting 'refreshes the soul'
description: At the largest exhibition of his watercolors to date, painting enthusiast Prince Charles has described the restorative benefits of art, saying it "transports me to another dimension."

title: The unvaccinated tennis star admits he didn't immediately isolate after testing positive for Covid-19
description: • Djokovic is leaving a 'complicated' legacy

title: Russia and NATO meet for make-or-break talks on Ukraine crisis
description: Representatives from Russia and NATO are meeting in Brussels on Wednesday for high-stakes talks aimed at defusing growing tensions over Russia's military buildup near the Ukraine border.

title: What we know: Novak Djokovic's visa fallout
description: Novak Djokovic's Australian Open participation has provided a tumultuous backdrop to the tournament. The Serbian world No. 1 was detained in Australia last week over a visa and vaccination dispute, and on Tuesday released a lengthy statement addressing his movements in December 2020.

title: Texas sheriff under investigation for allegedly seizing money from undocumented immigrants
description: A Texas sheriff is under investigation for allegedly seizing money from undocumented immigrants during traffic stops.

title: Two LAPD officers fired for playing Pokémon GO and ignoring robbery call
description: Two Los Angeles officers have lost an appeal and their jobs after an April 2017 game of Pokémon GO.

title: Former Turkey international defender Ahmet Calik dies at age 27
description: Former Turkey international Ahmet Calik has died at the age of 27, his former club Konyaspor confirmed on Tuesday.

title: The couple who bought and renovated a century-old home in Japan's countryside
description: Near the town of Fujino, off busy Route 20, just 65 kilometers west of Tokyo, sits a narrow, single-lane tunnel.

title: As candidates refuse to disavow McConnell, Trump comes to terms with his grip on GOP
Dozens of South Korean employees test positive for Covid-19 after attending tech event in US
Ja Morant stars as rampaging Grizzlies beat Warriors for 10th straight victory
description: Ja Morant scored a game-high 29 points to help fire the Memphis Grizzlies to an NBA-best 10th straight victory with a 116-108 defeat of the Golden State Warriors on Tuesday.

title: Olympic medalist Deon Lendore dies aged 29
description: Deon Lendore, an Olympic and world championship medalist from Trinidad and Tobago, died in a car accident in Texas on Monday. He was 29.

title: Soldiers in Burkina Faso arrested for alleged plot to conspire against the government
description: Eight soldiers in Burkina Faso were arrested on Tuesday on suspicion of conspiring against the government, the military prosecutor's office said.

title: Why Republicans aren't likely to lose any Senate seats in 2022
description: Wisconsin's Republican Sen. Ron Johnson announced he was running for reelection on Sunday. That should be viewed as good news by Republicans, who need a net gain of just one seat in this year's midterm elections to wrestle Senate control from the Democrats.

title: Body of ex-Senate Democratic leader Harry Reid to lie in state in Capitol Rotunda
description: The body of former Senate Democratic leader Harry Reid will lie in state in the Rotunda of the US Capitol on Wednesday, a rare honor granted by Congress to about three dozen other Americans, including former presidents, Supreme Court justices, lawmakers and national security officials.

title: Joe Judge becomes fifth NFL coach to be fired as New York Giants part ways
description: Joe Judge became the fifth NFL coach to be fired after he was relieved of his duties by the New York Giants on Tuesday.

title: The residential cruise ship offering a 'more affordable' life at sea
description: For many cruise lovers, living on a ship permanently is a long-held, albeit extremely unrealistic, dream.

title: Simon Cowell and Lauren Silverman are engaged
description: Simon Cowell and his longtime partner, Lauren Silverman, are getting married, a representative for the "America's Got Talent" judge confirmed to CNN on Wednesday.

title: Jeannie Mai and rapper husband Jeezy welcome their first child together
description: TV host and fashion stylist Jeannie Mai Jenkins has announced the birth of her first child with rapper husband Jeezy.

title: You can learn to put names to faces while you sleep, study finds
description: Need to quickly put a name to a face on a company video call? About to play charades online with your new partner's entire family? Or are you fretting about putting a name to that colleague's face when you do go back to work in person?

title: 'King Kazu' reign goes on as 54-year-old footballer Kazuyoshi Miura joins Suzuka
description: Kazuyoshi Miura will continue his professional career into his 55th year this season after the former Japan international striker joined fourth tier Suzuka Point Getters on loan from Yokohama FC on Tuesday.

title: KFC Australia and McDonald's Japan are running low on chicken and french fries
description: If you're looking for your usual order at a KFC in Australia or McDonald's in Japan these days, you might be disappointed.

title: Mikaela Shiffrin clinches record-breaking 47th World Cup slalom win
description: American skier Mikaela Shiffrin pipped her Slovakian rival Petra Vlhova to victory on Tuesday to earn a record-breaking 47th World Cup slalom win.

title: 'Zero-Covid' China fights to contain Omicron as restrictions tighten in major city
This giant exoplanet is so 'deformed' it looks like a football
description: In the search for planets beyond our solar system, astronomers have found a giant exoplanet that looks more like a football or rugby ball than a sphere.

title: Online fitness training or in-person workouts: Which is better?
description: When the coronavirus pandemic temporarily closed gyms nationwide in 2020, many people opted to do their workouts at home through online instruction. Even after fitness facilities reopened, a good number of individuals elected to stay at home. That's probably why online training nabbed the top spot in the Worldwide Survey of Fitness Trends for 2021, a poll conducted annually by the American College of Sports Medicine.

title: Internet balloons look to do what Google and Facebook couldn't
description: The Tanzanian islands of Zanzibar and Pemba are about to become a test site for a mobile internet network its creators hope will not just revolutionize lives there, but possibly across sub-Saharan Africa and beyond.

title: WHO director makes bleak prediction for Omicron surge in Europe
description: The Omicron variant is forecasted to infect more than half of all Europeans in the next six to eight weeks, a World Health Organization official said as he urged nations to strengthen mask rules and warned that the window to act was closing.

title: 'What a moron': Hot mic captures Fauci firing back at GOP senator
description: During a Senate hearing, Dr. Anthony Fauci called Republican Sen. Roger Marshall of Kansas a "moron" after a heated exchange.

title: Infrared images reveal hidden figures beneath $40-million Botticelli painting
description: Sandro Botticelli's rediscovered and arresting "Man of Sorrows," due to be auctioned at Sotheby's on January 27 -- with a guarantee of $40 million -- has yet to be studied extensively, as it has been in private hands since the 19th century.

title: Massachusetts schools use dogs to sniff out Covid-19
description: CNN's Gary Tuchman reports on an elementary school in Massachusetts using dogs to sniff out Covid-19.

title: UK lawmaker breaks down when revealing mother-in-law died alone of Covid
description: UK lawmaker, Jim Shannon, made an emotional request during a Parliament session regarding an investigation into alleged parties during lockdown.
